result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Booking on 11/2/22, not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.

2:49 PM Defendant Marcus L. Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court states case and appearances.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE explains why he didn't appear at INIT - says he didn't get the mail.  New address provided.  DE wants to have counsel.  Court sets new AIA so DE can get counsel.  State agrees to signature bond.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking on not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
